definition: Emperor of Japan
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
day/sky/heaven
emperor/old variant of 惶[huang2]
surname Huang

sentences.english: At last, the emperor of Japan announced capitulation.
sentences.chinese: 終於，日本天皇宣佈投降。

sentences.english: Japan’s emperor Hirohito tragically vacillated over the war.
sentences.chinese: 日本天皇裕仁對戰爭的優柔寡斷是悲劇性的。

sentences.english: Japan'semperor wants to retire. Is he allowed to?
sentences.chinese: 日本天皇想要退位，他是否有權這樣做？

sentences.english: Hu extends condolences to Japanese emperor.
sentences.chinese: 胡錦濤致電日本天皇表示慰問。

sentences.english: On August 10, they prevailed, and the Emperor of Japan surrendered.
sentences.chinese: 8月10日，他們成功了，日本天皇投降了。

sentences.english: The power of Mikado in Japan is symbolic .
sentences.chinese: 日本天皇的權利是象徵性的。

sentences.english: Keenan (English Version): You've already told the court that the emperor loves peace, didn't you?
sentences.chinese: 那麼你已經對法庭說過日本天皇愛和平，是嗎？

sentences.english: Earlier Wednesday, Hu met Japanese Emperor Akihito.
sentences.chinese: 7日上午，胡錦濤會見了日本天皇。

sentences.english: Eg: The power of Mikado in Japan is symbolic .
sentences.chinese: 日本天皇的權利是象徵性的。

sentences.english: Cheney also had an audience with Japanese Emperor Akihito and Empress Michiko later in the day.
sentences.chinese: 切尼還在當天晚上會見了日本天皇和皇后。

sentences.english: On December 25, 1926, Hirohito became Emperor of Japan.
STEVE EMBER: In this newsreel, we hear General MacArthur accepting the surrender of the Japanese Empire.
sentences.chinese: 紀錄片中能聽到麥克阿瑟將軍接受日本天皇的投降。

definition: emperor/emperor of Japan
Hirohito, personal name of the Shōwa 昭和[Zhao1 he2] emperor of Japan (1901-1989), reigned 1925-1989
Tojo Hideki (1884-1948), Japanese military leader hanged as war criminal in 1948
Japanese person or people
unconditional surrender
Prince KONOE Fumimaro (1891-), Japanese nobleman and militarist politician, prime minister 1937-1939 and 1940-1941
a grade A war criminal
TOYOTOMI Hideyoshi (1536-1598), Japanese warlord, undisputed ruler of Japan 1590-1598
Manchukuo
ASHIKAGA Yoshimitsu (1358-1408), third Ashikaga shogun, reigned 1368-1394
ITŌ Hirobumi (1841-1909), Japanese Meiji restoration politician, prime minister on four occasions, influential in Japanese expansionism in Korea, assassinated in Harbin
prime minister (of Japan or UK etc)
Yasukuni Shrine, Shinto shrine in Tokyo to Japanese war dead, controversial as burial ground of several Class A war criminals
formal title of the Japanese prime minister
pinyin: Nei4 ge2 Zong3 li3 Da4 chen2

definition: Japan
Abe Shinzo (1954-), Japanese LDP politician, prime minister 2006-2007 and from 2012
